action.action-desc: Mr. Hurd of Texas (for himself, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Katko, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mr. Walker, Mr. Loudermilk, Ms. McSally, and Mr. Ratcliffe) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To reduce duplication of information technology at the Department of Homeland Security, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the DHS IT Duplication Reduction Act of 2015.

paragraph.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Chief Information Officer of the Department of Homeland Security shall submit to the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate a report that includes the following:

subparagraph.text: The number of information technology systems at the Department of Homeland Security.
An assessment of the number of such systems that are duplicative.
A strategy for reducing such duplicative systems, including an assessment of potential cost savings or cost avoidance as a result of such reduction.

subsection.text: In this Act, the term information technology has the meaning given such term in section 11101 of title 40, United States Code.

This section shall be carried out using amounts otherwise appropriated or made available to the Department of Homeland Security. No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section.
